intro: Oldenlandia ocellata, commonly known as the "Eye of the Sky" or "Stickyweed," is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers with a distinctive white or yellow eye-like marking. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered with fine hairs, while the stems are slender and branching. The flowers are usually borne in clusters and are pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
